activities.loc: JCB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:30 AM Defendant Daniel L Schultz in court.  Attorney Kari S. Hoel in court for Daniel L Schultz.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Court Reporter appeared by Zoom video means. 
THIS COVERS 21CF354, 22CF48, 22CF107, 22TR831, 22TR920, and 21TR1730.

22TR831 - Guilty plea entered. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty.
22TR920 - Dismissed.
21TR1730 - Dismissed.

22CF107 - Dismissed and read-in.

22CF48 - Defendant pleads guilty to count 2. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in.

21CF354 -
Count 1 - Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty.
Count 3 - State moves to amend to OWI 2nd. Court grants amendment. Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty.
Counts 2, 7, & 8 - Dismissed and read-in.

Court orders PSI in 21CF354 & 22CF48.  Must report to DOC today.  Bond continues.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 10:00 am.

(Clerked by ABarnes)
Court relates and orders: 
22TR831 -
$811.50 forfeiture with 60 days to pay.
6 month drivers license revocation.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment. .087 non aggravated.

21CF354 - Count 3:
$1,555.00 fine with 60 days to pay.
20 days jail. Must report to jail by 5:30 p.m. on Friday, November 4, 2022. Credit for time served. Huber and good time granted.
16 month license revocation
16 month ignition interlock device
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment. .206 non aggravated.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

Sentence credit to be submitted by stipulation of counsel. Defendant will qualify for 1/2 priced IID.

Felony admonitions given.
Final pre-trial on November 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:44 AM Defendant Daniel L Schultz appeared by video.  Attorney Kari S. Hoel appeared by video for Daniel L Schultz. Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin
COVERS 21CF354, 22CF48 & 21TR1730. 
Court relates files were set before Branch 3 for further scheduling.
Attorney Hoel relates on working on a global resolution.  State relates. Court sets Jury Trial in 21CF354 for December 9, 2022 at 8:00 a.m. and that 22CF48 and TR file are to Track.  Court relates the TR file is to be decided by the Court that day, and not the Jury.  Proposed Jury Instructions, Witness Lists, Verdict Forms, any Motions and Notice of Intent to Use Video are to be filed no later than FPT date of November 29, 2022 @ 10:00 a.m.  Defendant must appear in person for FPT.   Address and phone number confirmed in 21CF354  Bond continues.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Scheduling conference on September 13, 2022 at 09:45 am.

COVERS 21CF354, 22CF48, 22CF107 (ARGN), 21TR1730, 22TR831 & 22TR920.

22CF107 - Formal reading of Information waived.  Not guilty pleas entered.  No agreement.  JT set for at 11/09/22 8:00 a.m. Proposed Jury Instructions, Witness Lists, Verdict Forms, any Motions and Notice of Intent to Use Video are to be filed no later than November 1, 2022.  Reminder note given in court.  Address and phone number confirmed.  

22TR831 and 22TR920  - Not guilty pleas entered.   Continue to track with 21CF107.

21CF354, 22CF48 & 21TR1730  are to be sent to Judge Boyle for further scheduling.

10:29 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel L Schultz appeared by video.  Attorney Kari S. Hoel appeared by video for Daniel L Schultz.
Covers 21CF354, 21TR1730 and 22CF48
Attorney Hoel relates.  Both cases and citations set before Judge Babler in person.  Bond continued.
Status hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel L Schultz in court.  Attorney Kari S. Hoel appeared by video for Daniel L Schultz. This covers cases 22CF107, 22CF48, 21CF354, & 21TR1730.  Court relates.  Attorney Hoel relates. 

22CF107 -  Attorney Hoel relates and requests preliminary examination.  PH set before Judge Babler on 6/8/2022 at 2:45.  Parties may appear by Zoom.

21CF48 - Reading waived, not guilty pleas entered. Hearing set for 7/6/2022 at 10:00 before Judge Boyle.  Parties may appear by Zoom. 

21CF354 - Reading waived, not guilty pleas entered. Hearing set for 7/6/2022 at 10:00 before Judge Boyle.  Parties may appear by Zoom. 

21TR1730 - Reading waived, not guilty pleas entered. Hearing set for 7/6/2022 at 10:00 before Judge Boyle.  Parties may appear by Zoom.
